page.title: 04WOKINGHAM - A GROWING TOWN
page.content: The population of Wokingham in{1981 {CENSUS}was 24184, 11.5% retired, 6% pre-school and 27% aged 5 - 19 years. Births exceeded deaths by 60 - 80 each year since then. Population{ {GROWTH}is projected at 27741 for l985 and 29000 for l987 with main increases in Evendon Ward which includes new housing areas at Woosehill and Eastheath. Emmbrook and Wescott remain static. Wescott has highest % of retired and lowest % of pre-school children. 80% of households are{OWNER OCCUPIED Only 17.5% have no car, but 2% still have no bathroom. 43% of heads of households are{PROFESSIONAL OR {MANAGERIAL}and a further 25% are also non-manual. Unemployment is about 7.5% - well below national average of l3%. By 1991 population is expected to stabilise at just under 30000.
